isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - REMOVE - LEFT REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

figure.caption: Figure 129. Left Reverse Idler Gear Assembly Exploded View

step1.para: Move the mainshaft reverse gear as far to the rear as possible and remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear ( Figure 130).

figure.caption: Figure 130. Remove Snap Ring From I.D. of Gear

step1.para: Move the reverse gear forward and against the LO speed gear, the splines of the mainshaft sliding clutch ( Figure 131).

Use inside jaw pullers or impact puller to remove the auxiliary countershaft front bearing race from the left reverse idler gear bore ( Figure 132). If necessary, repeat the procedure for removing the auxiliary countershaft front bearing race from the right reverse idler gear bore.

figure.caption: Figure 132. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing Race

step1.para: Remove the stop nut and washer from the front of the idler shaft ( Figure 133).

figure.caption: Figure 133. Remove Stop Nut and Washer From Front of Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the pipe plug from the rear of the idler shaft and use an impact puller, 1/2 inch-13 threaded end, to remove shaft from case bore ( inset, Figure 134).

figure.caption: Figure 134. Remove Pipe Plug and Remove Shaft From Case Bore
Figure 135. Remove Thrust Washer and Gear From Case

step1.para: If necessary, remove the inner race from the bearing and remove the needle bearing from the idler gear ( Figure 136).

figure.caption: Figure 136. Remove Inner Race From Bearing and Remove Needle Bearing
